title: Vitesco picking up semiconductors from Rohm
short_description: Continental’s drive division Vitesco Technologies has selected Rohm Semiconductor as its preferred partner for silicon carbide power semiconductors. Vitesco Technologies will use Rohm’s SiC technologies to increase the efficiency of its power electronics for electric vehicles.

title: Sweden’s EV market share remains at 20%
short_description: Despite the corona crisis and the resulting drop in car sales, the market share of BEV and PHEV in Sweden was again just over 20 per cent in May. The positive trend in plug-in sales is therefore continuing.

title: Mercedes taking orders for E-Class PHEVs
short_description: Mercedes-Benz has started selling the model update of the E-Class as a sedan and as a station wagon. The new lineup also includes plug-in hybrid variants, of which there will be seven in the new E-Class.

title: Norway registers 3,444 BEV in May
short_description: In Norway, 3,444 all-electric cars were registered in May, accounting for 43.1 per cent of all new passenger car registrations. With 610 units, the VW e-Golf was the most popular model across all drive types.

title: VW and Porsche rumoured to get new brand bosses
short_description: According to German media reports, Volkswagen is preparing a personnel shuffle in its brand management boards. VW Group boss Herbert Diess, who also runs the VW brand, apparently wants to bring Porsche boss Oliver Blume to Wolfsburg.

title: Punch Powertrain & PSA form new joint venture
short_description: The PSA Group and the Belgian transmission manufacturer Punch Powertrain have signed an agreement to set up a second joint venture and expand their strategic partnership in the field of electrification. This will focus on transmissions for HEV and PHEVs – also for other manufacturers.

title: Geely brand Geometry reveals second electric car for July
short_description: After Geely presented its electric car brand Geometry and its first model Geometry A last year, the brand’s second model, the Geometry C, will be launched on the Chinese market in July.

title: Tesla starts digging at Giga-Berlin
short_description: Now that Tesla received approval for foundation work from the Brandenburg State Office for the Environment, the work has now apparently begun in the usual rapid Tesla-tempo. A new drone video shows the first excavation works.

title: Audi announces taskforce for autonomous EVs
short_description: Audi launched a new project called Artemis. The core of the project is the development of new technologies for electric, highly automated driving with a concrete reference to the model. The first step is now to “develop a pioneering model quickly and unbureaucratically”.

title: USA: Toyota RAV4 PHEV to go on sale this summer
short_description: Toyota announced the 2021 RAV4 Prime plug-in hybrid would hit the US market this summer. With a base price of $38,100, the SUV’s first plug-in version has up to 42 miles purely electric range, making it the highest electric range of any PHEV SUV out there.

title: Renault to restructure for efficiency across the alliance
short_description: After alliance partner Nissan, Renault has also presented its restructuring program. The savings plan provides for the elimination of two billion euros in fixed costs. The strategy includes cuts in personnel.

title: VW to take over majority stake in JAC joint venture
short_description: Volkswagen has officially confirmed its plan to increase its stake in JAC Volkswagen, its joint venture for electric mobility, and to invest around one billion euros in this. The Wolfsburg-based company will invest another billion in a Chinese battery specialist.

title: Swindon Powertrain compact motor for conversions
short_description: British company Swindon Powertrain has now made its compact HPD 80kW ‘crate’ motor for electric vehicle conversions available to order from its website.

title: Nissan to close Barcelona plant but keep Sunderland
short_description: Nissan has presented its comprehensive renovation package. Europe is no longer considered a core market. The Barcelona plant will be closed while the plant in Sunderland is to continue to operate with alliance partner Renault.

title: Tesla gets foundation approval in Germany
short_description: Tesla has just received approval for foundation-building work for the Giga-Berlin plant in Grünheide near Berlin from the Brandenburg State Office for the Environment. In Berlin itself, the company has also found the location for the planned development and design centre.

title: BMW upgrades 5er and Mini Countryman PHEV versions
short_description: BMW has given the 5-series a model update and in this context has increased the range of plug-in hybrids to five versions. The small SUV Mini Countryman also has an update on the PHEV.

title: Renault UK: PHEV and HEV specifications and prices
short_description: Renault UK has confirmed full specifications of new E-TECH versions of the new Captur Plug-in Hybrid and Clio Hybrid. UK prices start from £19,595 for the Clio Hybrid and £30,495 for the Captur Plug-in Hybrid.

title: Renault-Mitsubishi-Nissan restructure cooperation
short_description: The Renault-Nissan-Mitsubishi manufacturing alliance is restructuring its cooperation. The guiding principle of the cooperation is the so-called ‘leader-follower’ principle for regions, vehicles and technologies in order to achieve greater efficiency and competitiveness in these areas.

title: Tesla reduces prices across the board
short_description: Tesla has just lowered the prices of its models, in some cases considerably, depending on country and model range. All Tesla models are affected by the price cuts with the exception of the new Model Y. In the USA, the Model 3 will also be around 2,000 dollars cheaper.

title: BMW X2 xDrive25e available from 47,250 euros
short_description: From July, BMW will also deliver the X2 compact SUV as a plug-in hybrid. The X2 xDrive25e will then cost at least 47,250 euros – and will also introduce some changes that will also be found in the combustion engine versions in the future.

title: Kia is considering an ultra-small electric car
short_description: Kia is examining plans to build a purely electric miniature car in the style of the Citroën Ami. Although the South Korean company has not revealed a timetable for these plans, it seems that Kia is already considering a new distribution model for the electric microcar.

title: Mercedes-Benz is now taking orders for the EQV
short_description: Mercedes has now opened the order books for the EQV. The premium electric van is initially available in the long-wheelbase version. The price in Germany currently starts at 71,388.10 euros.

title: Ford Mustang Mach-E to first reach Europe in 2021
short_description: The all-electric Ford Mustang Mach-E will probably not reach Europe this year, but only at the beginning of 2021, according to emails from Ford to reservation holders in some European countries. In the email, the US car manufacturer gives the reason as being the Covid-19 pandemic-induced interruption of production.

title: Evergrande breaks ground on e-drive production plant
short_description: The extremely ambitious electric car plans of the Chinese Evergrande Group are becoming more concrete: In Huzhou in Zhejiang Province, local media reported that the ground-breaking ceremony for a production facility of Evergrande for electric drive systems has now taken place.

title: Mazda launches production of the MX-30 in Ujina
short_description: Mazda has started production of the all-electric MX-30 at its plant in Ujina, Japan. In the second half of 2020 the electric car will roll into the showrooms of European Mazda dealers. While prices have not been released for most individual markets, in Germany, it will start at 33,490 Euros.

title: Jaguar to cancel I-Pace eTrophy after this season
short_description: Jaguar will discontinue the Formula E support racing series I-Pace eTrophy at the end of the season. Jaguar Racing cites a strategic reorientation due to the COVID-19 pandemic as the reason for the early finish of the one-make cup.

title: Polestar announces US retail locations
short_description: Polestar has announced their first retail partners for the US market, which will help Volvo’s plug-in brand to set up a network of so-called Polestar Spaces in New York and Los Angeles as well as San Francisco this year.

title: Ford updates Mach-E fast-charging data
short_description: Following real-life testing, Ford is updating the fast-charging data for the Mustang Mach-E. In the ‘Extended Range’ variant with battery and rear-wheel drive, the SUV’s charging performance is around 30% higher than the values stated before, the car manufacturer reports.

title: Mercedes-Benz Bank offering electric car insurance
short_description: Together with partner HDI, Mercedes-Benz Bank now offers “comprehensive” insurance cover for hybrid and electric vehicles. The new electric protection module is automatically added to insurance policies for EVs and thus does not incur any additional costs.

title: Mercedes is offering electric car insurance
short_description: Together with partner HDI, Mercedes-Benz Bank now offers “comprehensive” insurance cover for hybrid and electric vehicles. The new module of electrical protection is automatically added to comprehensive insurance policies for electric vehicles and thus does not incur any additional costs.

title: Tesla fast-tracks new Giga plant, Texas seems a winner
short_description: Tesla allegedly wants to build its planned next US plant in the Texan capital of Austin or the surrounding area of Austin. At least that is what Electrek reports, citing an insider privy to the plan. And the schedule for the new plant is hugely ambitious.

title: Tesla begins producing long-range China Model 3
short_description: Tesla has started production of the long-range version of the Model 3 in Shanghai, China. Deliveries are scheduled to begin shortly. However, the price is slightly higher than previously announced.

title: Ford Explorer PHEV arrives at customers in Europe
short_description: Ford has started deliveries of the Explorer plug-in hybrid SUV in Europe. The seven-seater went on sale last year but is only now arriving at dealerships with slight modifications Ford made to the drive.

title: Lightyear & DSM to develop solar roofs for vehicles
short_description: Lightyear, the startup company that emerged from the solar team at the Technical University of Eindhoven, presented its long-distance solar car Lightyear One last year. Now the startup wants to push the development of solar roofs for electric vehicles with the Dutch company DSM.

title: VW opens their first ID. Store in Germany
short_description: Volkswagen has opened their first ID. Store in Dresden. The flexible ID. Stores are designed to give interested parties the opportunity to find out more about ID.3 and all about e-mobility at Volkswagen. But a pop-up concept is also planned.

title: Tesla announces new Fremont production manager
short_description: Tesla has found a successor for Jatinder Dhillon. According to reports, Richard Miller now heads production at the Fremont plant. Miller is taking over the job at a difficult time, but there seems to be an “agreement” with Alameda County about reopening the plant.

title: Lordstown Endurance e-pickup to use in-wheel motors
short_description: For its planned e-pickup truck Endurance, the US startup Lordstown Motors relies on wheel hub motors from the drive specialist Elaphe Propulsion Technologies. Lordstown wants to produce the dedicated technology themselves.

title: CAM study: electric car sales rise in Europe and fall in China
short_description: The latest CAM data for the electric car sector from Jan to April 2020 paints an uneven development. The study notices a strong increase in electric vehicles sales in Europe in general, the UK in particular, with an increase in PHEV cars in Germany.

title: GM mostly sticks to electrification timetable
short_description: Despite the crisis, General Motors is sticking to the timetable for most of its electric offensive. By the middle of this decade, GM has also reaffirmed its goal of achieving annual sales of one million electric cars in the two largest markets, North America and China.

title: BYD to offer the Han electric sedan in Europe
short_description: BYD is targeting European markets and just announced to bring a second BEV here, its brand new Han electric sedan. The model was supposed to debut in April at Auto China, which was cancelled due to Covid-19 pandemic, and now will come to Europe.

title: First 800-volt electric car from Hyundai set for 2021
short_description: Deliveries of the all-electric crossover planned by Hyundai based on the concept electric vehicle 45 will begin in Europe in less than a year. On Facebook, technical data of the two battery versions are already being discussed.

title: EU: Plug-in cars at 6.8% market share in crisis-shaken Q1
short_description: Sales of electric cars and plug-in hybrid vehicles still increased across the EU in the first quarter of 2020. And while the Covid-19 crisis may explain the rather sudden tripling of market share, some countries and the segment as a whole experience robust growth.

title: Volvo planning a larger eSUV Coupé XC100
short_description: It seems Volvo is planning an XC100 Recharge as a purely electric model. According to an article in US media, the coupé-like SUV is not intended to replace the XC90, but should instead complement the model range with a difference.

title: Tesla opens Fremont against local regulations
short_description: Tesla has resumed production in Fremont, defying the Alameda County ban. Elon Musk is continuing his dispute with local authorities.

title: Triggo reveals light electric vehicle with adjustable width
short_description: The Polish company Triggo has developed an electric light vehicle for large cities that can retract in width from 148 to 86 centimetres if necessary thanks to a variable chassis. Triggo is initially targeting the vehicle-sharing market with the 1+1-seater.

title: Lexus UX300e to come with 10-year battery guarantee
short_description: Lexus will be offering a ten-year warranty (or one million kilometres) on all traction battery functions on its first BEV model UX 300e. The Japanese company has also released further details about the battery and its air cooling.

title: Tesla secures loan in China for Shanghai plant
short_description: Tesla has secured a further credit line of up to 4 billion yuan (around 521 million euros) from the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China for the expansion of its Gigafactory 3 in Shanghai.

title: Tesla Europe boss Sascha Zahnd leaves the company
short_description: Tesla has to find a new manager for its European business after only a few months. According to insider information, Tesla Europe boss Sascha Zahnd is leaving the company – allegedly because of disagreements with Elon Musk.

title: e.GO Life offered in further variants
short_description: The Aachen-based startup e.GO Mobile has updated the configurator for its Life small electric car. Following the e.GO Life First Edition, the e.GO Life 60 is now also available in a different configuration and the e.GO Life 40+ can now also be configured.

title: Fiat releases first 500e small electric car edition in UK
short_description: Buyers in the UK may now put an order in for the first 500 of Fiat’s extra compact electric car 500e. Prices for the limited ‘La Prima’ edition come in below the 30k threshold after government subsidies.

title: Tesla pushes Roadster to 2022 as Musk sets priorities
short_description: The new Tesla Roadster won’t hit the markets before 2022. That’s two years later than Elon Musk initially envisioned in 2017. The delay, however, is not due to the virus, officially but Tesla has too many other things on their plate.

title: Sygic adds electric car mode to navigation app
short_description: Slovakian navigation specialist Sygic has introduced an electric car mode to its App Sygic GPS Navigation. The new EV Mode allows route planning with compatible charging points, payment without installing an additional app and real-time data from the stations.

title: Electric car sales remain comparitively high in Sweden
short_description: Sweden’s passenger car market slumped by 36.9 per cent year-on-year in April due to the coronavirus crisis. Nevertheless, electric and plug-in hybrid registrations achieved a market share of 21.6 per cent – a trend that has been evident since the beginning of the year.

title: BMW Vision M Next halts serial production
short_description: The Vision M Next hybrid concept presented by BMW last year was touted as the presumed successor to the i8 sports car, giving a glimpse of the electrified future of the BMW M brand. Now BMW has apparently put a stop to the plans because of the Corona pandemic.

title: Nissan Europe adds Voltia electric delivery van to its range
short_description: The fully-electric van is a version of the e-NV200 with a larger load floor. Until now, the model has been marketed by the e-mobility specialist under its own management but from now on, the model will be sold by Nissan in Europe as the Nissan e-NV200 XL Voltia.

title: Poland put premium purchase on hold but EV sales are rising
short_description: Initially, Poland had planned start spending a lavish purchase premium of 8,600 euros for low-cost electric cars from December. Then the country postponed the subsidy indefinitely for a short time. Nevertheless, e-car registrations are rising – a placebo effect?

title: Škoda electric Enyaq to come in 5 variants
short_description: Škoda has now announced technical details for the first purely electric production model based on MEB; the Enyaq SUV. Five different performance variants (three with rear-wheel drive and two with four-wheel drive) and three battery sizes will be available.

title: Order books open for VW ID.3 First Edition 17 June
short_description: Pre-orderers of the VW ID.3 1st Edition can place a binding order for their vehicle from 17 June, as was announced by Jürgen Stackmann, Member of the Board for sales. The pre-purchase contracts will also be a test run for the new agency model for the distribution of the ID. models.

title: Nissan to introduce e-Power in Thailand
short_description: Nissan intends to introduce its range extender drive e-Power soon in Thailand where it will also be produced. Until now this range extender drive has only been offered in Japan.

title: UK: BEV marketshare at all-time high due to all-time low of car sales
short_description: The coronavirus crisis makes for interesting data. With the British car market at an all-time low – no more than 4,321 new cars were listed this April – electric cars, Tesla especially, came out on top with sales staying relatively stable YoY.

title: Norway: Almost half of all cars sold in April were electric
short_description: In Norway, 3,671 new electric cars were registered in April. Electric vehicles accounted for 49.4 per cent of new passenger car registrations. Once again, the Audi e-tron was the most popular model across all drive types.

title: BAIC brand Arcfox launches debut BEV in China
short_description: The first series-production electric car from Arcfox, a dedicated EV brand by BAIC BJEV, is now going on sale in China. The Arcfox Alpha-T is a large electric SUV with premium standards and a range of over 650 kilometres.

title: BYD to launch in Europe this year
short_description: BYD plans to start selling electric cars in Europe in 2020. Not surprisingly, the Chinese manufacturer has chosen Norway as its entry market, where BYD will initially launch with the all-electric SUV Tang EV600.

title: Norway sold 3,671 BEVs in April
short_description: In Norway, 3,671 new electric cars were registered in April. Electric cars accounted for 49.4 per cent of new passenger car registrations. Once again, the Audi e-tron was the most popular model across all drive types.

title: Arcfox is launching their debut BEV in China
short_description: The first series production electric model from Arcfox, a BAIC BJEV brand, is now going on sale in China. The Arcfox Alpha-T is a large electric SUV with premium standards and a range of over 650 kilometres.

title: BYD plans to launch in Europe in 2020
short_description: BYD plans to start selling electric cars in Europe this year. Not surprisingly, the Chinese manufacturer has chosen Norway as its entry market, where BYD will initially launch with the all-electric SUV Tang EV600.

title: Nissan could withdraw from Europe
short_description: Nissan reportedly wants to withdraw from Europe and instead focus more on its main markets: the USA, China and Japan. The news comes through sources of Reuters and also includes repercussions on the alliance’s e-mobility offering.

title: Aiways announces improved safety for U5 battery
short_description: Before the market launch of the electric SUV U5, the Chinese manufacturer Aiways has published further details about the battery modules. These have a new sandwich structure, which according to the manufacturer should lead to greater stability and significantly reduce the risk of damage to the battery.

title: Volkswagen takes Seat off small electric car project
short_description: Volkswagen has relieved its Seat brand of responsibility for the development of the planned MEB small electric car for under 20,000 euros, insiders say. The decision is related to the fact that Seat has indefinitely postponed its market entry in China.

title: Audi e-tron Sportback set to launch in USA this summer
short_description: Audi officially announced the market launch of its second all-electric model in the US, the e-tron Sportback, which will join the e-tron SUV in Summer. This addition to the electric car family drives a little further and has a different body shape.

title: New Corolla Trek hybrid available in the UK
short_description: Toyota has revealed the official pricing and specifications for the new Corolla Trek in the UK, a new version of the British-built Corolla Touring Sports hybrid. Prices for the petrol-electric hybrid start at £29,225.

title: Huber+Suhner show high-voltage distribution system
short_description: The Swiss company Huber+Suhner has presented its latest series-produced high-voltage distribution solution for all types of electric vehicles. The mHVDU (modular High Voltage Distribution Unit) can handle up to 800 volts DC voltage.

title: BYD remains flexible as quarterly profits drop
short_description: BYD’s net profit in the first quarter fell by around 85 per cent year-on-year from 749.7 million yuan to 112.6 million yuan (almost 14.6 million euros). Revenues in the first quarter fell by 35 per cent to 19.68 billion yuan.

title: Tesla reports tiny profit in Q1/20 – 3rd time in a row
short_description: Tesla just published its quarterly earnings and despite the crisis-shaken last part of Q1, the company reports a profit. It is the third consecutive quarter in which Tesla is in black, this time with 16 million dollars.

title: Impulse for new Formula E team from Italy
short_description: The Italian businessman Gianfranco Pizzuto plans to enter Formula E with his own team in Imecar Elektronik. The aim is to participate in the 2021 or 2022 season, but there are still a few hurdles to overcome before then – such as financing or unavailable grid positions.

title: Ford brand Lincoln will not use Rivian platform
short_description: Lincoln has announced that it will not build an electric car based on Rivian’s EV platform. The surprising end of the project comes only about three months after its announcement. Lincoln now wants to push its first electric car on its own.

title: Audi withdraws from DTM to focus on Formula E
short_description: Audi will leave the German Touring Car series (DTM) at the end of this year and concentrate fully on Formula E. “With this energy, we’re going to drive our transformation into a provider of sporty, sustainable electric mobility forward,” says Markus Duesmann, Chairman of the Board at AUDI.

title: Xpeng Motors brings 2nd model to market in China
short_description: Xpeng Motors launched its second production model in China. After the G3 e-SUV was released in late 2018, the P7 E-Limousine is now on the market, with prices starting at 229,900 yuan (around 29,950 euros) after subsidies. In addition, there are unconfirmed reports of an imminent launch in Europe.

title: Audi brings out PHEV version of the A6 station wagon
short_description: Audi is expanding its range of electrified models: Following the A6 saloon, the station wagon version of the Audi A6 is now also being launched as a plug-in hybrid. The new A6 Avant TFSI e quattro offers up to 51 kilometres of electric range in the WLTP cycle with prices starting at 71,940 euros.

title: BMW iX3 photos leaked without camouflage
short_description: On Instagram, two photos of the BMW iX3 have appeared showing the electric SUV in the series version without camouflage. The differences between these images and the concept shown so far are minimal.

title: VW factory in China producing an eSUV
short_description: In China, according to a number of media sources, VW has begun the production of prototypes presented last year as an electric SUV concept called ID. Roomzz. The seven-seater is apparently first set for launch on the Chinese market in 2021, presumably as VW ID.6.

title: Hyundai Prophecy concept rumoured to replace Ioniq
short_description: According to a British media report, the Prophecy electric concept vehicle recently presented by Hyundai will go into series production and is to replace the Ioniq. The new electric limousine could come onto the market by 2021.

title: Polestar 2 pricing out for the USA
short_description: Polestar has published the prices for its first purely electric model in the USA. The list prices of the Polestar 2 start at 59,900 US dollars: The battery-electric car qualifies for the federal tax credit of 7,500 dollars.

title: Toyota Yaris to get hybrid SUV offshoot
short_description: The Toyota Yaris is to receive an SUV offshoot. Like the new Yaris, the newly presented Yaris Cross is based on the small car platform TNGA-B hybrid system and will have 116 HP system power. The new model is to be launched in Europe in summer, 2021.

title: Another Renault, Nissan & Mitsubishi EV alliance?
short_description: A Japanese news site claims that Renault, Nissan and Mitsubishi have a plan that will expand their alliance. In May, the three companies plan to start jointly developing electric vehicles and automated driving technologies.

title: Study shows that light weight does not benefit EVs
short_description: In contrast to vehicles with combustion engines, lightweight construction in electric vehicles does not have any advantage over steel in terms of total energy and total emissions. This is the result of a research project by Manuel Schweizer, a student at the Technical University of Ingolstadt (THI).

title: Porsche planning entry-level Taycan
short_description: In addition to the familiar 4S, Turbo and Turbo S variants, Porsche is planning a new entry-level version with rear-wheel drive and a smaller battery for its Taycan electric model. The German company also has its sights set on a specific market to launch the model in.

title: Land Rover introduces hybrid Evoque & Discovery Sport
short_description: Land Rover has introduced its two smallest SUVs, Evoque and Discovery Sport, with a specially developed plug-in hybrid drive. Both models are also available for immediate order.

title: Byton furloughs half their US workforce
short_description: Byton furloughed half of their workforce employed at the U.S. headquarters in Santa Clara, California, due to the effects of the pandemic. Apparently, the production launch of the M-Byte is also at risk.

title: Second gen Opel Mokka to include fully elecrtric variant
short_description: For the second generation of the Opel Mokka, a purely electrically driven version will also be offered for the market launch. Production of the new mocha is scheduled to start in the fourth quarter of this year.

title: Subaru’s first electric model to drop in 2021
short_description: According to media reports, the first electric model of Subaru will be called Evoltis and will have its world premiere at the Tokyo Motor Show in October 2021. The electric SUV will be based on the electric vehicle platform developed by Subaru together with Toyota.

title: Toyota has 3 new BEVs for the Chinese market
short_description: Toyota is launching three electric models on the Chinese market on April 26. One of these vehicles is also soon to be sold in select European markets.

title: Mazda patents a hybrid Wankel drive
short_description: Mazda has patented an extraordinary hybrid drive with a Wankel engine in Japan. The system works with a total of three electric motors and, according to Mazda, is primarily intended to be lighter than current electric four-wheel-drive systems.

title: Maple 30x is a new low-cost EV from China
short_description: A new electric car brand launched in China named Maple. Maple is a joint venture between Geely and Kandi’s Fengsheng Automotive Technology Group. The brand’s first model, the Maple 30x, is to be launched at prices of less than 9,000 euros.

title: Nio launches delivery of revised ES8
short_description: The Chinese electric car manufacturer Nio has started deliveries of the new edition of its ES8 model. The electric SUV has been revised in many areas and is now offered with a new 100 kWh battery pack, among other things.

title: Triton Solar announces massive electric SUV named Model H
short_description: Triton Solar of New Jersey has announced a giant eight-seat electric SUV that will have a range of more than 700 miles (1,126 kilometers) on a 200-kWh battery. Pre-orders are already being taken, but there are also doubts about the project.

title: Porsche Taycan 4S now available in the USA
short_description: Porsche has added an entry-level Taycan 4S to join the Taycan Turbo and Turbo S at U.S. dealerships. The official EPA estimated range for the Taycan 4S is 203 miles, and prices start at $103,800.

title: Tritium prepares to launch Finland’s first electric supercar
short_description: Tritium Automotive from Finland is working on a purely electric sports car with 500 kW power and a range of up to 300 kilometres. Initially only eleven units are planned – at a unit price of one million euros.

title: FAW building new NEV factory in Changchun
short_description: The Chinese car manufacturer FAW has begun construction on a new plant in Changchun, where electrified cars are to be produced for its premium brand Hongqi. Completion of the plant, which will have an annual production capacity for 200,000 vehicles, is scheduled for 2022.

title: Karma Automotive’s first BEV to drop in 2021
short_description: Karma Automotive has announced its first fully electric production model. The Karma Revero GTE will be available in the USA from spring 2021 and in China and Europe from autumn 2021. Prices for the electric luxury sedan are not yet available.

title: Formula E suspended til June at minimum
short_description: As governments around the world continue to take stringent measures to curb the spread of the Corona pandemic, Formula E and the FIA have decided to extend the suspension of the season until at least the end of June.

title: Tesla revising Giga Berlin application
short_description: According to the Brandenburg state government, Tesla must revise the application for approval of the planned first Gigafactory in Europe. This also means that the documents will be made public again.

title: Formula E reduces development costs to help teams
short_description: Formula E and the FIA have announced that in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, they will reduce the financial burden on their teams by reducing development costs. At the same time, it is still unclear at the moment how the current season will continue.

title: CAG-Nio launch the first BEV in the Hycan brand
short_description: Chinese manufacturers GAC and Nio have launched their first electric model on the Chinese market under the joint brand Hycan. The all-electric mid-sized SUV Hycan 007 is offered with two battery options of 73 and 93 kWh capacity.

title: Missouri offers billions in US Tesla plant bid
short_description: In the USA, the city of Joplin in Missouri has made a formal bid for Tesla’s new Gigafactory. In Germany, Tesla’s Giga Berlin is making progress with local infrastructure.

title: COVID-19: First carmakers reopen factories in Europe
short_description: Following the pandemic closure of production facilities around the globe, first carmakers are carefully reopening the plants to begin making cars and components again. We will update the electric vehicle-related reopenings continuously here.

title: Will BMW release three 7 Series electric cars?
short_description: When announcing its annual figures last month, BMW confirmed that the next generation of the 7 Series would also have a purely electric model. Now it seems that they may even be planning three electric versions of the 7-series.

title: Renault Group will only make electric cars China
short_description: Renault has adjusted its strategy for China and will in future concentrate fully on electric vehicles and light commercial vehicles. This includes the French company withdrawing from its joint venture with Dongfeng through which they had built conventional ICEs and transferring its shares in DRAC to Dongfeng.

title: New electric car registrations are up in Sweden
short_description: In Sweden, electric cars and plug-in hybrids achieved a market share of 27.2 per cent in March. The winner among the BEVs and PHEVs was the Tesla Model 3 with a total of 1,084 new registrations.

title: Tesla Model 3 Long-Range option ready to go in China
short_description: Tesla is apparently planning to start selling the locally produced Model 3 with Long-Range battery pack in China this week. So far, the Model 3 is only offered in China in the Standard Range+ version.

title: BYD March figures show recovery in vehicle markets
short_description: The market for new energy vehicles (NEV) in China seems to be recovering from the effects of the Coronavirus: Chinese vehicle-making giant, Build Your Dreams (BYD) sold 337.25 per cent more electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids in March than the extraordinarily weak sales figures from February.

title: Polestart teases more details regarding Precept
short_description: At the end of February, Polestar presented the Precept, as a preview of future electric models. More details were to be revealed at the Geneva Motor Show in March, but since the car show was cancelled, Polestar has now revealed slightly more about the company’s design direction with the Precept.

title: Škoda Citigo-e iV sells out fast in the UK
short_description: The Škoda Citigo-e iV can no longer be ordered in Great Britain. Around 400 units of the Czech-built fully-electric city car made for the UK market have now sold out.

title: Lifecycle assessment: Electric cars vs ICEs
short_description: Is an electric car more climate-friendly than a vehicle with a combustion engine or not? And if so, under which conditions is that the case? A team at the Environment Campus Birkenfeld in Trier now published a new study – not using metadata, but real-world tests and measurements. The results are remarkable.

title: MW Motor & UAZ will build an electric 469 Hunter
short_description: After the formidable Luka EV retro presented in 2018, the Czech company MW Motors is now attracting attention with a new project: MW Motors Spartan is a fully off-road electric vehicle based on the 469 Hunter from the Russian manufacturer UAZ.

title: Tesla boosts Model Y production capacity in Fremont
short_description: up Tesla is using the period of the widespread closure of its plant in Fremont, California, due to the Covid 19 pandemic to make several improvements, including increasing production capacity for the Model Y.

title: Tesla is boosting Model Y production capacity in Fremont
short_description: Tesla is apparently using the period of the widespread closure of its plant in Fremont, California, due to the Covid 19 pandemic to make several improvements, including increasing production capacity for the Model Y.

title: Rivian postpones delivery launch til 2021
short_description: After the US electric car startup Rivian had interrupted production preparations for its two debut electric cars due to the Covid 19 pandemic, it is now clear that the plan to start production and deliveries before the end of this year cannot be kept.

title: Renault to release compact eSUV in 2021
short_description: Renault’s planned all-electric compact SUV based on the new CMF-EV electric vehicle platform should be ready for spring 2021. A new media report also alleges that Renault designated the factory to build the new electric car already as well.

title: Mercedes to offer AMG version of the EQS electric car
short_description: Mercedes offers its particularly powerful models, for example with specially developed V8 and V-12 engines under the AMG subsidiary. According to media reports, an electric Mercedes from AMG will soon be available.

title: Chevy Bolt no longer subsidized in the USA
short_description: Starting as of this month, the USA has stopped subsidizing General Motors’ only electric model to date, the Chevrolet Bolt. General Motors is the second carmaker after Tesla to reach the limit of cars sold.

title: Ford adjusts UK prices for Mustang Mach-E SUV
short_description: Ford has revealed final UK prices for its new Mustang Mach-E and first deliveries will start before the year’s end. The entry-level model with a 76kWh battery is priced from £40,270. The extended-range version is £49,900 and has a 99kWh battery pack.

title: Honda to use GM’s new electric vehicle platform
short_description: Honda will use GM’s recently introduced new electric vehicle platform with Ultium batteries as both manufacturers now agreed to develop two BEV models for Honda together. General Motors will make the new electric cars for Honda at its plants in North America.

title: Norway: Electric cars take 55.9% market share in March
short_description: Electric car sales in Norway continue the trend to take over market shares in strides. Pure battery-electric models show particular strength. Plug-in hybrid vehicles also continue to find favour across the country.

title: Audi A8 won’t come as electric car
short_description: Audi is backing away from its initial idea of making its next-generation A8 sedan a battery-electric vehicle. Instead, the A8 will have a plug-in hybrid version with a more extended range.

title: Tesla production & delivery report Q1/2020
short_description: Tesla delivered 88,400 electric cars in the first quarter of the year despite the Covid-19 crisis. It is significantly more than analysts had expected given the current situation, although it is less than in the final quarter of 2019.

title: e.GO Mobile applies for self-administered insolvency
short_description: The Aachen-based electric car manufacturer e.GO Mobile has filed an application for a protective shielding procedure with Aachen Local Court – a special form of insolvency in self-administration. The Chinese investor planning to join the German startup apparently could not participate as intended due to the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Audi provides new EV platform details
short_description: Audi promises 30 electrified models by 2025, 20 of which will be BEVs. Audi USA has now provided further details of the four platforms on which these electric cars will be built. More information has also been revealed on the upcoming PPE architecture being developed jointly with Porsche.

title: BYD & Toyota JV is ready to launch
short_description: Toyota and BYD have completed the formation of their announced joint venture to jointly develop BEVs and their batteries. The joint venture, called BYD Toyota EV Technology (BTET), is based in Shenzhen and is scheduled to start operations in May.

title: BMW Brilliance launches new factory construction
short_description: BMW Brilliance has begun construction of a new production facility on the existing Chinese plant site in Tiexi, a district of Shenyang in Liaoning Province. With the new plant, BMW Brilliance (BBA) intends to double production capacity at the site.

title: BYD faces slumping profits
short_description: The Chinese electric car and battery manufacturer BYD has published its preliminary results for the 2019 fiscal year. At just under 121.8 billion yuan, sales were on a par with the previous year, but profits slumped by 42 per cent to around 1.6 billion yuan.

title: Volkswagen is gearing up for PHEV business
short_description: In addition to its fully electric models in the ID. series, VW is also planning to roll out further plug-in hybrid versions of the combustion engine series. Before the end of this year, VW plans to present PHEV variants of the Arteon and Tiguan.

title: Aiways U5 available starting in April
short_description: The Chinese electric car start-up Aiways will be taking pre-orders from European customers for its fully-electric SUV U5 from the end of April. Aiways intends to announce the required down payment for the European advance sales markets later this month.

title: Chevy Bolt update postponed by one year
short_description: General Motors is postponing the 2021 launch of the revised fully-electric Chevrolet Bolt by one year due to the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic. The new Chevy Bolt will therefore not be offered until model year 2022.

title: BMW provides data on i Hydrogen Next
short_description: BMW has now revealed the first technical details of the drive system in the i Hydrogen Next concept that the manufacturer presented at the IAA 2019 on the basis of an X5. The manufacturer provides some data on both the fuel cell and the car’s electric drive.

title: Giga-Berlin construction forges ahead despite pandemic
short_description: The cleared forest area for Tesla’s planned Giga-Berlin factory in Grünheide, Germany, has now been almost completely levelled. According to a local news outlet, Brandenburg’s State Environmental Agency now wants to allow the foundations to be built in advance, despite 373 objections to the project.

title: BYD forms FinDreams to sell components
short_description: BYD will be offering electric car components to third parties in order to diversify their income sources in the face of dwindling demand for cars. The components business is to be conducted through the recently founded sub-brand FinDreams.

title: German carmakers behind the curve in electric cars
short_description: With the impressive Porsche Taycan, German engineers have shown all their skills. It proves that continued inaction is the highest risk for German domestic brands. At the same time, outdated vehicle designs remain electric top sellers.

title: BMW North America brings back 330e PHEVs
short_description: BMW of North America will release the 330e and 330e xDrive on the US market on 20 May. Prices for the plug-in-hybrid sedans in the States start at $44,550 for the 330e and $46,550 for the 330e xDrive.

title: Ford & GM show low electric vehicle production targets
short_description: Despite commitments to e-mobility by Ford and General Motors, the two largest US American carmakers intend to produce only about 320,000 electric vehicles in North America by 2026, which is only about five per cent of the combined vehicle production of both manufacturers there.

title: Volkswagen ID.3 still suffering from software issues
short_description: Alleged software problems with the VW ID.3 development have been treading the rumour mill recently. Now a spokesperson officially confirmed the issues, while insider information reflects a more dire reality.

title: P3 Charging Index: Which electric car charges best on long-distance trips?
short_description: Any claimed range or specified maximum charging power must be treated with caution when wanting to know how fast you’ll really progress on longer journeys with one or more charging stops.

title: Mercedes EQV electric van passes winter tests
short_description: Mercedes-Benz subjected the EQV to an endurance test in Arjeplog, Sweden. The electric V-Class proved its operational capability under extreme conditions at temperatures as low as minus 30 degrees Celsius, icy roads and deep snow.

title: Sweden: marketshare for plug-in vehicles nears 25%
short_description: In Sweden, electric cars and plug-in hybrids achieved a market share of 24.3 per cent in February. The background to the new car registration boom is primarily a change in the Swedish subsidy system, which came into force at the turn of the year.

title: Tesla introduces new contactless deliveries in the USA
short_description: Tesla has officially introduced several new options for the delivery of its electric cars. The ‘contactless’ car delivery is naturally due to the ongoing coronavirus crisis, but other options are more extensive in scope.

title: Aston Martin reveals technical details to hybrid motor systems
short_description: After Aston Martin recently postponed plans for battery-electric cars, the British sports car manufacturer has now published more details of its electrification plans. These mainly focus on hybrid engines.

title: Polestar launches serial electric car production in China
short_description: In Luqiao, China Polestar has kicked-off series production of the Polestar 2 BEV. The Volvo subsidiary’s all-electric car is to be launched on the European market first, with deliveries planned to start summer 2020 before coming to the US and China.

title: JLR to convert Castle Bromwich to e-mobility centre
short_description: According to a media report, Jaguar Land Rover wants to expand its historic plant in Castle Bromwich into a production centre for electric vehicles. The first three models have also already been named.

title: Mercedes-Benz to launch electric cars in India
short_description: Daimler has announced expansion plans on the Indian subcontinent. In the next two years, the German carmaker aims to release a total of ten electric vehicles as Mercedes in India, local media reports.

title: Italian students design electric off-road concept
short_description: The Istituto Europeo di Design has presented an electrically powered concept vehicle called Tracy, designed by students of the Master’s degree course in Transport Design in Turin. Based on the plans of the Italian students, it was built under the roof of EDAG Italia.

title: Maserati postpones their BEV premiere
short_description: FCA subsidiary Maserati has postponed the presentation of its first electrified sports car until September 2020 due to the Covid 19 pandemic. Originally, the event was to take place in May. As a result, the relaunch of the brand has also been postponed.

title: Porsche to invest billions more in electrification
short_description: Porsche is investing around 10 billion Euros in the hybridization, electrification and digitalization of its vehicles by 2024 and, according to their own statements, is “consistently” expanding the range of products in the field of electric mobility.

title: Nissan to electrify all product lines in Japan
short_description: Nissan is gearing up to electrify all new and redesigned models to hit the Japanese market starting in the fiscal year 2020 under tighter emissions rules, local media has learned. There is also news on the upcoming models.

title: Electric carmaker Nio is lacking liquidity
short_description: The Chinese electric vehicle maker Nio raised substantial doubt in its ability to continue its business due to on-going financial difficulties that have been exacerbated by the coronavirus. The reduced EV subsidies in China also played a part.

title: Hyundai raises range of Kona EV made in Europe
short_description: Hyundai has increased range of the Kona Electric with 64 kWh battery from 449 to 484 kilometres (WLTP). That’s 35 km more, and the gains have been achieved by mostly mechanical means. Besides, a rear-mounted bicycle carrier is now also available.

title: BMW confirms electric car in upcoming 7-series
short_description: BMW has now officially confirmed that the next-gen 7 Series will include a fully electric model for the first time but not exclusively as a BEV. However, there is still no official confirmation for the presumed battery-electric version for the 5-series.

title: Polestar sets up wholly-owned spin-off in China – Jixing
short_description: Volvo’s electric car brand Polestar registered a wholly-owned subsidiary in Shanghai on 11 March. Polestar calls its China spin-off Jixing Automobile and has tasked it with the wholesale and retail of vehicles and auto parts.

title: Peugeot offers electric bonus in the UK
short_description: In order to boost sales, Peugeot UK will offer an extra £500 towards new fully electric vehicle purchases. This follows the Government announcement that it would reduce the current Plug-in Car Grant (PICG) from £3,500 to £3,000 starting on 12 March.

title: Coronavirus: Carmakers shut down plants across Europe
short_description: First carmakers announce closures of factories in Europe due to the Coronavirus crisis unfolding on the continent. PSA will lockdown all vehicle production plants in Europe by 27 March and the French carmaker is not the only one.

title: Apex Motors introduces all-electric sports car AP-0
short_description: The British brand Apex Motors has introduced an all-electric sports car called AP-0. The EV is scheduled to go into production at the end of 2022, and Apex says prices will start at 150,000 pounds (before taxes). Down payments are already accepted.

title: First Hyundai Kona Electric delivered from European plants
short_description: Hyundai has delivered the first examples of the Kona Electric from European production to customers. The more powerful of the two Kona Electric versions is produced at the Hyundai plant in Nošovice, Czech Republic.

title: BMW launches eDrive Zones for plug-in hybrids
short_description: BMW has activated the eDrive Zones digital service for the first PHEV models. This is intended to allow cars to automatically switch to electric mode when entering a certain zone, such as inner cities.

title: VW’s small, low-cost electric car ID.1 to come in 2023
short_description: Rumours of a new small, low-cost electric car from Volkswagen have been persistent. According to a British media report, the model, presumably called ID.1, will replace the VW e-Up starting in 2023 and will be about the same size.

title: UK: Renault & MG Motor top up PiCG until end of March
short_description: As the British government cuts the Plug-in Car Grants, first carmakers react. Renault UK will top-up the new PiCG of £3,000 by £500 for all Zoe orders placed before 31 March 2020.

title: Volvo XC40 Recharge electric car goes on sale in UK
short_description: The Volvo XC40 Recharge is now on sale in the UK for £53,155. Volvo’s first all-electric car will arrive at dealers in late 2020. The XC40 is not eligible for the £3,000 Plug-in Car Grant (PiCG) because it costs more than £50,000.

title: Bollinger publishes details of electric car chassis
short_description: The US electric car start-up Bollinger Motors has now presented in detail the platform on which its first two models B1 and B2 are based. The goal: to offer the platform to other manufacturers in future.

title: Two-month break in Formula E’s ongoing season
short_description: Following the cancellation of individual races, Formula E and the FIA have now announced that the 2019/20 season will be completely suspended for at least two months due to the Covid 19 spread. Even after that a resumption is not guaranteed.

title: Bollinger publishes details of their electric chassis
short_description: The US electric car start-up Bollinger Motors has now presented in detail the platform on which its first two models B1 and B2 are based. The goal: The platform is to be offered to other manufacturers in the future.

title: Two month break in Formula E’s ongoing season
short_description: Following the cancellation of individual races, Formula E and the FIA have now announced that the 2019/20 season will be completely suspended for at least two months due to the Covid 19 spread. Even after that a resumption is not guaranteed.

title: Workhorse puts electric pickup development on hold
short_description: With the W-15 the US manufacturer Workhorse wanted to launch an electric pickup with a range extender. As the company has now confirmed to electrive, the pickup project was discontinued several months ago.

title: Tesla does not expect delays to Gigafactory 4
short_description: Tesla does not anticipate any delays in the construction of the Brandenburg factory due to the withdrawal of its American employees from Germany because of the coronavirus. The ground-breaking ceremony is still expected to take place in April.

title: Frank Weber joins BMW management board
short_description: BMW continues to restructure its Board of Management. As the carmaker announced, Klaus Fröhlich, member of the Board of Management responsible for Development, will not extend his contract and will leave the company at the end of June. Frank Weber will take over in July.

title: Sono Motors announces new CFO
short_description: Sono Motors has appointed Torsten Kiedel to the company’s Management Board with immediate effect. The Chief Financial Officer’s (CFO) main task is to ensure the financing of the electric car start-up.

title: First Model Y to be delivered on Friday
short_description: The first Tesla Model Y will be delivered on this coming Friday 13 March. Only deliveries to customers on the US West Coast have been announced so far. The company has obviously sped things up, since until now, 15 March was said to be the earliest possible date for delivery.

title: Porsche’s batteries are too heavy for the 718
short_description: The electric versions of the Porsche 718 series – Cayman and Boxster – have still not been given the green light for production, according to Michael Steiner, Executive Vice President for Development. The Stuttgart-based sports car manufacturer is therefore continuing to postpone the decision.

title: Mini Cooper SE US market launch complete
short_description: The first electric Mini, the 2020 electric Mini Cooper SE has officially arrived at U.S. showrooms over the weekend with a suggested retail price (MSRP) of $29,900 plus an additional $850 Destination & Handling fee.

title: Tesla considers another Gigafactory in the USA
short_description: According to Elon Musk, Tesla is currently looking for a location for another plant in the USA. The Cybertruck is to be produced there, as well as the Model Y for customers on the US East Coast. Texas is apparently in the race.

title: Wolong & ZF officially launch joint venture
short_description: ZF Friedrichshafen and the Wolong Electric Group have officially sealed the foundation of their joint venture, which was agreed upon in November. The objective of “Wolong ZF Automotive E-Motors Co Ltd.” is the development and production of electric motors and components.

title: Extreme E: QEV entry and live-streaming deal
short_description: QEV Technologies have confirmed they will make up the fifth team for the premiere season of the Extreme E. The inter-continental electric motorsport spectacle will be broadcast by the BBC.

title: Fiat’s plans for an electric Panda in series production
short_description: Fiat will apparently also build the Panda in its own electric version. The car manufacturer has apparently decided to put the Concept Centoventi that was presented in 2019 into series production.

title: Ford counts 40,000 + pre orders for the Mustang-E
short_description: Ford apparently has more than 40,000 pre-orders for its Mustang Mach-E electric SUV. This means that this year’s planned production of 50,000 units will soon be sold out.

title: BMW halts plans for the iX3 in the USA
short_description: According to a report, BMW has put on hold its plans to offer the all-electric iX3 in the USA from the first half of 2021. In a market where long-range and all-wheel-drives are preferred, the sales environment for the electric car looks difficult.

title: Peugeot keeps the 108 and plans all-electric version
short_description: According to CEO Jean-Philippe Imparato, a few weeks ago Peugeot decided to keep making its small car model 108, and the executive added that Peugeot could then offer the 108 as a pure electric car – possibly with the technology of the new Fiat 500.

title: Tesla plans for production increase in Shanghai
short_description: How many Model 3 can Tesla build in the Gigafactory 3 near Shanghai? A new report from China provides details of the planned increase in production at the factory as well as new models. In other Tesla news, we look at software updates.

title: Honda is planning a second BEV by the end of 2022
short_description: Honda plans to launch a second fully electric model in Europe by 2022. This may well be the production version of the Honda Sports EV Concept electric sports car that was presented at the end of 2017.

title: Lucid Motors to opt for direct sales model
short_description: Lucid Motors, the electric car start-up, has announced details of its sales and service strategy and the locations of nine Lucid Studios in the USA. The first showroom has already opened at the company’s headquarters in Newark, California.

title: Volvo launches battery assembly in Ghent
short_description: Volvo Cars has inaugurated a battery assembly line at its Belgian production site in Ghent. The first batteries for the XC40 Recharge P8 will be assembled there in March. Production of the first electric Volvo is also scheduled to start in Ghent in the autumn.

title: Seat’s Cupra Formentor-SUV to come out as PHEV
short_description: Now that the new Leon and Cupra Leon will also be available as plug-in hybrids, Seat is now presenting the series version of the first vehicle developed exclusively for the performance brand Cupra: the Cupra Formentor SUV now available as a PHEV. The part-time electric car should be launched before the end of this year.

title: Fiat Chrysler premiere the “new 500” BEV in retro style
short_description: Fiat has just premiered the battery-electric 500, which is simply called the “new” 500. The differences to the previously sold combustion engine go beyond the drive system and the price for the small electric car is relatively high.

title: General Motors reveal new battery system and platform
short_description: At an “EV Day” for investors, General Motors CEO Mary Barra presented an overview of the Group’s ambitious electric strategy. At the heart of the strategy is the third-generation new platform involving a modular battery system called Ultimum. The platform should base the spectrum of electric vehicles from hatchbacks to pickups, SUVs and commercial vehicles.

title: Aiways shows the near-series U6ion
short_description: Chinese electric car startup Aiways has presented the U6ion – a near-series concept of what will be the company’s second model. The crossover coupé is based on the same platform as the U5 electric SUV but is distinctly different in appearance – with a few curious details.

title: Norway: 5,145 all-electric cars registered in February
short_description: 5,145 new zero-emission cars were registered in Norway in February just past. The market share of purely electric cars in new passenger car registrations was thus 49.7 per cent. In total, including HEV and PHEV, 79.2 per cent of all newly registered cars in Norway had either an electric or hybrid drive. The Audi e-tron […]

title: Gumpert Aiways starts Nathalie in small series
short_description: Gumpert Aiways has announced the start of production for the first series model with methanol fuel cell. The First Edition of the Roland Gumpert Nathalie is a special edition with lavish equipment and special paintwork offered at a price of 407,000 euros.

title: Škoda Octavia RS is to be a plug-in-hybrid
short_description: After Škoda presented the fourth generation of the Octavia in November with a plug-in hybrid for the first time, the Czech Volkswagen brand has now presented the Octavia RS iV, the first PHEV model in its RS family.

title: Tesla revs up preparations for Model Y deliveries
short_description: Tesla’s much-anticipated plans to hand over the first copies of the Model Y to customers on March 15 are apparently running on schedule. Fans have shared photos of Model Ys ready for transport and a peek at the EV’s interior. Tesla is also on schedule in China and Brandenburg as we keep you updated on […]

title: Mercedes to offer more PHEVs in compact and e-class cars
short_description: Mercedes is now going to introduce the PHEV drive system already brought to the A- and B-Class to the other compact models. The CLA 250 e (as Coupé and Shooting Brake), and the GLA 250 e, should be available for order from spring onwards. In the future, the E-Class will be available in seven PHEV […]

title: Renault allows a peek at the Dacia Spring
short_description: Renault released a preview of the first electric model of the Dacia brand with the show car Dacia Spring. As expected, this is a modification of the Renault City K-ZE that is being offered in China at competitive prices.

title: BMW’s i4 heads towards series production
short_description: With the Concept i4, BMW has presented the near-series version of its electric Gran Coupé, which is scheduled for market launch in 2021. The German carmaker claims that the Concept i4 “takes electric drive to the core of the BMW brand and heralds a new era”.

title: Volkswagen births the ID.4 out of the ID. Crozz
short_description: Volkswagen has given a “concrete outlook” on a fully electric compact SUV. The model, for which the study has so far been called ID. Crozz, will be called ID.4 as a production vehicle. This is the second MEB model after the ID.3, and should be launched before the end of this year.

title: Byton M-Byte pre-orders to start in EU before year’s end
short_description: Before the end of this year, Chinese manufacturer Byton will be accepting advance orders from European customers for its first electric model M-Byte – for a reservation fee of 500 euros. Byton has also revealed some details on the planned distribution and charging service.

title: Renault’s new study Morphoz showcases CMF-EV platform
short_description: Renault’s new model study should show the way of future developments with the new CMF-EV platform. The Morphoz is distinguished through an interesting body extension, inductive charging capabilities and level 3 autonomous driving functions.

title: Formula E: Double DS Techeetah podium in Marrakesh
short_description: Never before a polesitter in Marrakesh managed to claim a victory. On Saturday Antonio Felix da Costa (DS Techeetah) dominated the qualifying and race and defended the top spot, followed closely by the man who replaced him at BMWi Andretti Motorsport, Maximilian Günther. Da Costa’s teammate Jean-Eric Vergne climbed from P11 up to P3 in […]

title: Mercedes launches A 250 e production
short_description: Mercedes-Benz has started production of the plug-in hybrid versions of the A-Class at its compact car plant in Rastatt. However, Mercedes does not specify when the vehicles will be delivered to customers.

title: Aiways will skip dealerships in Europe
short_description: Aiways will offer its new battery electric SUV U5 in Europe exclusively through direct sales and not through traditional dealer networks. After sales and service will be ha ndled by partners – the first ones for Europe have now been named.

title: Citroën shows off a light electric car for 6,000 euros
short_description: Citroën has just presented an electric two-seater called the Ami that is based on the Ami One Concept from 2019. With this light city vehicle that requires no driving licence, the French company wants to make electric mobility available to everyone. Our electrive staff attended the premiere in Paris.

title: Nissan UK launches Leaf e+ N-TEC Limited Edition
short_description: Nissan UK is launching an N-TEC edition of the Leaf e+ with a 62-kWh battery, limited to 1,000 units.  The limited-edition will join the cross-car line N-TEC versions of Micra, Qashqai and X-trail that were launched in January.

title: Kia prioritises Europe over US in face of battery trouble
short_description: Kia will be initially concentrating on getting its electric models to Europe before attempting to satisfy demand in the USA due to limited availability of batteries. The awkward situation for the popular carmaker was revealed in an interview with a top Kia manager in the USA.

title: ZSW analysis shows global number of EVs at 7.9 million
short_description: In 2019, the worldwide stock of passenger cars and light commercial vehicles with battery-electric drives or with range extenders, as well as plug-in hybrid drives has increased to around 7.9 million, 2.3 million more than a year ago.

title: GM to begin upgrading Detroit factory in March
short_description: Preparations for the conversion of the Detroit-Hamtramck production facility into a pure electric car plant, announced by General Motors at the end of January, will begin in March. There are also reports of concrete subsidies for the planned GM battery factory in Ohio.

title: GKN testing new drive in the Arctic Circle
short_description: GKN Automotive continues their tests on the 3-in-1 powertrains and has several prototypes underway in the Arctic Circle. New inverters and motors are being used in the test vehicles based on the Tesla Model 3 and Fiat Ducato.

title: Nio launches production of the EC6
short_description: The Chinese electric car manufacturer Nio has started production of its third model after the ES8 and ES6. The start of production at the indebted company is also made possible thanks to a framework agreement with the city of Hefei, which is providing Nio with a billion-euro cash injection.

title: Sono Motors announces financing update
short_description: Sono Motors has released an update on the development and financing of the Sion. Among other things, the Sion’s work packages and suppliers are being defined while other aspects, such as the legal details of their Sono Points system will still take some time.

title: Micro Mobility presents Microletta & Microlino 2.0
short_description: After Micro Mobility Systems announced in January that it would be developing its Microlino to series production readiness together with the Italian company CECOMP, the Swiss company will present the visually and technically revised Microlino 2.0 at the Geneva Motor Show.

title: e.GO Mobile presents 2 Life derivatives in Geneva
short_description: The German electric car start-up e.GO Mobile will be presenting the e.GO Life Concept Cross at the Geneva Motor Show, which is to be launched as a limited small series in 2021. In addition, the company will also be showing the near-series sports version e.GO Life Sport and the e.GO Mover with updated software.

title: Polestar Precept shows a design future
short_description: Polestar has shown a foretaste of future electric models of the brand under the name Precept. The concept is a fully electric four-door Grand Tourer, which will be presented at the Geneva Motor Show in March.

title: VW Touareg to become a plug-in hybrid
short_description: Volkswagen will present the Touareg R at the Geneva Motor Show in a few days. This means that the large SUV – now the brand’s top model after the phase-out of the Phaeton – will also have a plug-in drive.

title: DS 9 to be released with 3 PHEV variants
short_description: With the new DS 9, the PSA brand DS Automobiles has presented its top model, for which three PHEV variants are planned. However, only one version of the plug-in drive is to be available for the market launch, the other two are to follow “with a certain time lag”.

title: First Model Y to be delivered on March 15th
short_description: Tesla has sent emails to Model Y pre-orderers in the USA promising to start deliveries in March. March 15 is apparently the earliest date.

title: Will software problems delay VW’s ID.3?
short_description: According to an article in German media, Volkswagen is still having massive software problems with ID.3. There is apparently some risk that the market launch of the first MEB model will have to be postponed. The group’s subsidiaries Audi and Porsche are also having their own troubles, only with batteries.

title: European Model 3 almost sold out for the quarter
short_description: The Tesla Model 3 is apparently almost sold out in Europe for this quarter. As of this week, Tesla has indicated that May will be the expected delivery date for the Model 3 in almost all European countries. The company previously forecast delivery in March.

title: Lucid signs supply agreement with LG Chem
short_description: Lucid Motors has signed a long-term supply contract with LG Chem. The contract covers the supply of LG Chem battery cells for the standard version of the Lucid Air electric sedan until 2023.

title: Renault Twingo Z.E to be released this year
short_description: Renault has introduced the Twingo Z.E. and announced that sales are scheduled to launch at the end of this year. The battery-electric version of the small car will be equipped with an electric motor with 60 kW output and a water-cooled battery pack with a capacity of 21 kWh.

title: Audi presents e-tron & Sportback S models
short_description: Audi has now presented the more powerful S variants of the e-tron and e-tron Sportback with three electric motors. Their drive layout is based on the concept with two different asynchronous motors (ASM), designed as a modular system from the beginning of the e-tron series.

title: Seat to produce hybrid Cupra Leon
short_description: The Seat brand Cupra has presented its first model with plug-in hybrid drive. The Cupra Leon eHybrid will be launched this year as a five-door model and as a station wagon version with the addition of a Sport Tourer. The technology comes from the VW Golf 8 eHybrid GTE.

title: Chevrolet launches Menlo EV sales in China
short_description: Chevrolet has started selling its first all-electric model on the Chinese market. The Menlo EV is a fully electric SUV with a NEDC range of up to 410 kilometers and is available at prices starting at 159,900 yuan (approx. 21,000 euros) after the government subsidy.

title: Audi pauses e-tron production in Brussels
short_description: Audi is completely stopping production of the e-tron in Brussels for a few days due to supply chain issues. Short-time work has been announced for the plant, as the company has confirmed.

title: New details on electric racing series PURE ETCR
short_description: Under the name PURE ETCR, the world’s first all-electric multi-brand touring car championship has now been presented. It is due to start its first full season in 2021, with several demo events already planned for this year.

title: Is Tesla working on a 110 kWh battery?
short_description: Tesla is working on a 110-kWh battery pack if leaked documents on their battery management system firmware are to be trusted. This should enable ranges of well over 400 miles or the equivalent of 644 km. There are also rumours that European Model Y enthusiasts will have to wait until 2021 for their cars.

title: Details on Kia Sorento hybrid and PHEV versions
short_description: At the beginning of March, Kia will be exhibiting the new generation of the SUV Sorento at the Geneva Motor Show. Kia has announced the new platform and powertrains and has published a little information about the hybrid and plug-in hybrid versions.

title: Mercedes low and zero-emissions in police design
short_description: Mercedes-Benz is presenting the EQC, GLC F-Cell and the E 300 de in police livery at the General Police Equipment Exhibition & Conference (GPEC) in Frankfurt am Main.

title: VW & Dealers agree on ID. sales model
short_description: Volkswagen and its partner association VAPV have agreed on a new distribution model in Germany for the all-electric ID. family. The agency model has apparently proven its worth in the fleet customer segment and will now be used in a similar form for private and small commercial customers.

title: BMW adds 3 new PHEVs to 3 Series
short_description: BMW is expanding the plug-in hybrid range for its 3 Series. Following the introduction of the 330e Sedan, the new 330e Touring will also be available from this summer onwards. The two four-wheel-drive PHEV variants, the 330e xDrive Sedan and the 330e xDrive Touring, will be launched in parallel.

title: 240 EV companies raised $17Bn in 2019
short_description: Dutch consultancy EVBoosters has released its latest funding report for 2019, with some of the trending developments reported here. Expect number-crunching covering Q4 in e-mobility funding and investment insights.

title: Citroën C5 Aircross PHEV up for order in the UK
short_description: Citroën has officially opened the order books for the new C5 Aircross plug-in hybrid in the UK. It is being offering it in two grades named the Flair and Flair Plus. Pricing starts at £35,340 and £36,815 respectively. Customer deliveries will begin in mid-2020.

title: Fiat Chrysler starts Fiat 500 BEV pre-series production
short_description: Fiat Chrysler has completed the production lines for the electric version of the Fiat 500 at its Mirafiori plant in Turin and has started production of the pre-series. Production of the hybrid version of the Maserati Ghibli has also started.

title: BMW looks to fully electrify 7 & 5 Series
short_description: BMW wants to offer the top model of the 7-series with a fully electric drive starting in 2022, while the 5-series will be made available in electric versions a little later. Both series will also continue to be offered as diesel, gasoline and hybrid vehicles.

title: Honda’s Jazz e:HEV will be selling in Europe this summer
short_description: Honda has introduced the new Jazz, which is only offered as a hybrid in Europe. The market launch is scheduled for summer this year.

title: Dacia to launch its city car electric debut within two years
short_description: Renault has now officially confirmed that the first electric model from its Romanian subsidiary Dacia will come out within the next two years. There are many indications that this will be the modified version of the Renault City K-ZE electric compact car offered in China for the European market.

title: Mercedes-Benz to build new e-model in Bremen
short_description: The Mercedes plant in Bremen in northern Germany has been awarded the contract to build a new electric model – which one is unknown as of yet. The EQC will continue production at the plant.

title: Maserati to electrify all new models and produce in Italy
short_description: Maserati is clarifying its electrification strategy: the Italian brand will introduce hybrid and purely battery-electric drives in all new Maserati models. Besides, all the electrified vehicles will be developed and built entirely in Italy.

title: Formula E: Jaguar reigned supreme in Mexico
short_description: Panasonic Jaguar Racing’s Mitch Evans dominated a crash-filled race this weekend and took P1 from Porsche’s Andre Lotterer on the first corner, which he held to the very end to secure the win at the Mexico City E-Prix. Four seconds behind him followed DS Techeetah’s Felix da Costa, while Nissan e.dams’ Sebastian Buemi rounded off […]

title: Interview: Protean CEO Andrew Whitehead & Local Motors’ John B. Rogers on start-up synergies and autonomy
short_description: US Local Motors caught the eye with a 3D-printed autonomous shuttle Olli as early as 2017. Fast-forward to 2020, and we sat down with CEO John B. Rogers and his partners from Protean. The British company that now belongs to Evergrande through NEVS just launched mass production of its hub motors. So Protean CEO Andrew […]

title: Construction kicks off for Gigafactory 4
short_description: The construction preparations for the planned European Gigafactory of Tesla in Brandenburg have begun. The clearing of a 91 hectare pine forest began on Thursday evening. Brandenburg’s Minister of Economics Jörg Steinbach announced the launch via Twitter.

title: Audi e-tron 50 priced in the UK
short_description: The lower performance version of Audi’s first electric vehicle, the e-tron, will be available in the UK starting at £59,900, excluding the government’s £3,500 plug-in car grant.

title: Tesla uses share boost to secure fresh capital
short_description: Tesla is taking advantage of the recent rise in its share price and issued new shares to obtain fresh capital. In gross terms, Tesla could raise up to 2.3 billion US dollars including the over-allotment option.

title: Nidec introduces two new electric axle drives
short_description: Nidec announced the expansion of its range of drive systems for electric vehicles by two new versions: The new versions are to be launched in the 50 kW and 200 kW power ratings. Series production is scheduled to begin in 2022 (50 kW) and 2023 (200 kW).

title: European premiere for the Mustang Mach-E
short_description: Ford has now presented the Mustang Mach-E for the European public for the first time at an event. At their Europe Roadshow Ford is taking the opportunity to inform consumers about the US-American company’s path to an electrified future. Part of this plan includes installing 1,000 charging stations at European company locations over the next […]

title: Six months free charging for UK Peugeot customers
short_description: Peugeot has announced that a free six-month subscription to the Polar Plus charging network will be included with each new electric or plug-in hybrid car sold. This coincides with the launch of their new hybrid vehicle range and their first fully electric vehicle on the UK market.

title: Tesla presents environmental deal for Gigafactory 4
short_description: There are updates on Tesla’s planned Gigafactory in Brandenburg: Tesla presented an environmental protection package in response to demands from nature conservationists. According to the package, Tesla wants to hang up about 400 nesting boxes and resettle several forest ant colonies.

title: Chinese EV sales drop significantly
short_description: The electric vehicle sales of the Chinese manufacturers BYD, BAIC BJEV and Nio declined sharply in January. The main reasons for this were the few business days in January due to the comparatively early New Year holidays and the outbreak of the coronavirus.

title: Škoda’s first MEB e-car to be an SUV named Enyaq
short_description: Škoda has announced that its first purely electric SUV will be called Enyaq. With this model, the Czech brand is establishing a new family of names that combines the ‘E’ as a reference to electric mobility with the ‘Q’ in the name of its SUVs.

title: Canoo & Hyundai to co-develop EV platform
short_description: The US American electric vehicle startup and the South Korean automotive giant have teamed up in an engineering partnership to develop electric vehicles.
